question: What characteristic describes spyware?

options.A: an attack that slows or crashes a device or network service
options.B: the use of stolen credentials to access private data
options.C: software that is installed on a user device and collects information about the user
options.D: a network device that filters access and traffic coming into a network

question: Which statement describes network security?

options.A: It synchronizes traffic flows using timestamps.
options.B: It supports growth over time in accordance with approved network design procedures.
options.C: It ensures sensitive corporate data is available for authorized users.
options.D: It prioritizes data flows in order to give priority to delay-sensitive traffic.

question: An administrator is trying to configure the switch but receives the error message that is displayed. What is the problem?

options.A: The entire command, configure terminal, must be used.
options.B: The administrator must first enter privileged EXEC mode before issuing the command.
options.C: The administrator is already in global configuration mode.
options.D: The administrator must connect via the console port to access global configuration mode.

question: What is a characteristic of a switch virtual interface (SVI)?

options.A: Although it is a virtual interface, it needs to have physical hardware on the device associated with it.
options.B: SVIs do not require the no shutdown command to become enabled.
options.C: An SVI is created in software and requires a configured IP address and a subnet mask in order to provide remote access to the switch.
options.D: SVIs come preconfigured on Cisco switches.

question: What is a user trying to determine when issuing a ping 10.1.1.1 command on a PC?

options.A: what type of device is at the destination
options.B: if there is connectivity with the destination device
options.C: if the TCP/IP stack is functioning on the PC without putting traffic on the wire
options.D: the path that traffic will take to reach the destination

question: Which PDU is processed when a host computer is de-encapsulating a message at the transport layer of the TCP/IP model?

options.A: segment
options.D: packet

question: What OSI physical layer term describes the measure of the transfer of bits across a medium over a given period of time?

options.A: latency
options.D: bandwidth

question: What is the maximum possible throughput between the PC and the server?

options.A: 128 kb/s

question: A network team is comparing topologies for connecting on a shared media. Which physical topology is an example of a hybrid topology for a LAN?

options.A: ring
options.D: bus

question: What does a router do when it receives a Layer 2 frame over the network medium?

options.A: de-encapsulates the frame
options.B: re-encapsulates the packet into a new frame
options.C: forwards the new frame appropriate to the medium of that segment of the physical network
options.D: determines the best path

question: Although CSMA/CD is still a feature of Ethernet, why is it no longer necessary?

options.A: the development of half-duplex switch operation
options.B: the use of full-duplex capable Layer 2 switches
options.C: the virtually unlimited availability of IPv6 addresses
options.D: the use of Gigabit Ethernet speeds

question: What routing table entry has a next hop address associated with a destination network?

options.A: local routes
options.D: remote routes

question: If the default gateway is configured incorrectly on the host, what is the impact on communications?

options.A: The host can communicate with other hosts on remote networks, but is unable to communicate with hosts on the local network.
options.B: There is no impact on communications.
options.C: The host can communicate with other hosts on the local network, but is unable to communicate with hosts on remote networks.
options.D: The host is unable to communicate on the local network.

question: Which term describes a field in the IPv4 packet header that contains a unicast, multicast, or broadcast address?

options.A: TTL
options.D: destination IPv4 address

question: Why is NAT not needed in IPv6?

options.A: Because IPv6 has integrated security, there is no need to hide the IPv6 addresses of internal networks.
options.B: The end-to-end connectivity problems that are caused by NAT are solved because the number of routes increases with the number of nodes that are connected to the Internet.
options.C: The problems that are induced by NAT applications are solved because the IPv6 header improves packet handling by intermediate routers.
options.D: Any host or user can get a public IPv6 network address because the number of available IPv6 addresses is extremely large.

question: PC1 has sent a frame addressed to PC3. What will the switch do with the frame?

options.A: The switch will forward the frame to all ports.
options.B: The switch will forward the frame only to port 2.
options.C: The switch will forward the frame only to ports 1 and 3.
options.D: The switch will discard the frame.
options.E: The switch will forward the frame to all ports except port 4.

question: PC1 issues an ARP request because it needs to send a packet to PC3. What will happen next?

options.A: RT1 will send an ARP reply with the PC3 MAC address.
options.B: RT1 will send an ARP reply with its own Fa0/0 MAC address.
options.C: RT1 will send an ARP reply with its own Fa0/1 MAC address.
options.D: SW1 will send an ARP reply with its Fa0/1 MAC address.
options.E: RT1 will forward the ARP request to PC3.

question: Which destination address is used in an ARP request frame?

options.A: the physical address of the destination host

question: A router boots and enters setup mode. What is the reason for this?

options.A: Cisco IOS is missing from flash memory.
options.B: The configuration file is missing from NVRAM.
options.D: The POST process has detected hardware failure.

question: What type of IPv6 address is represented by ::1/128?

options.A: unspecified
options.D: loopback

question: Which is the compressed format of the IPv6 address fe80:0000:0000:0000:0220:0b3f:f0e0:0029?
A user issues the command netstat –r on a workstation. Which IPv6 address is one of the link-local addresses of the workstation?
What task might a user be trying to accomplish by using the ping 2001:db8:FACE:39::10 command?

options.A: creating a network performance benchmark to a server on the company intranet
options.B: verifying that there is connectivity within the local network
options.C: verifying that there is connectivity to the internet
options.D: determining the path to reach the remote server

question: A client packet is received by a server. The packet has a destination port number of 22. What service is the client requesting?

options.A: DHCP
options.D: TFTP

question: What does the value of the window size specify?

options.A: the amount of data that can be sent before an acknowledgment is required
options.B: a random number that is used in establishing a connection with the 3-way handshake
options.C: the amount of data that can be sent at one time
options.D: the total number of bits received during this TCP session

question: To which TCP port group does the port 414 belong?

options.A: private or dynamic
options.D: public

question: Which command is used to manually query a DNS server to resolve a specific host name?

options.A: nslookup
options.D: net

question: What service is provided by POP3?

options.A: Uses encryption to provide secure remote access to network devices and servers.
options.B: Allows remote access to network devices and servers.
options.C: An application that allows real-time chatting among remote users.
options.D: Retrieves email from the server by downloading the email to the local mail application of the client.

question: Which networking model is being used when a student shares a folder directly with another?

options.A: client-based
options.D: peer-to-peer

question: Which statement describes the characteristics of packet-filtering and stateful firewalls as they relate to the OSI model?

options.A: A packet-filtering firewall typically can filter up to the transport layer, whereas a stateful firewall can filter up to the session layer.
options.B: A stateful firewall can filter application layer information, whereas a packet-filtering firewall cannot filter beyond the network layer.
options.C: A packet-filtering firewall uses session layer information to track the state of a connection, whereas a stateful firewall uses application layer information to track the state of a connection.
options.D: Both stateful and packet-filtering firewalls can filter at the application layer.

question: The city firewall is being flooded with traffic causing disruption. What type of attack is this?

options.A: DoS
options.D: reconnaissance

question: A network administrator is issuing the login block-for command. What threat is being prevented?

options.A: an unidentified individual trying to access the network equipment room
options.B: a worm attempting to access another part of the network
options.C: a user trying to guess a password to access the router
options.D: a device trying to inspect the traffic on a link

question: Which approach best provides cost effective redundancy for the Internet connection?

options.A: Add multiple connections between the switches and the edge router.
options.B: Add a second NIC to the web server.
options.C: Add a connection to the Internet via a DSL line to another ISP.
options.D: Add another web server to prepare failover support.

question: Only employees connected to IPv6 interfaces are having difficulty. What command verifies IPv6 routing?

options.A: show ip nat translations
options.D: copy running-config startup-config

question: Two network engineers are discussing switching. What is key to cut-through switching?

options.A: Fragment-free switching is the typical cut-through method of switching.
options.B: Packets can be relayed with errors when fast-forward switching is used.
options.C: The fragment-free switching offers the lowest level of latency.
options.D: Fast-forward switching can be viewed as a compromise between store-and-forward switching and fragment-free switching.

question: What happens when a switch receives a frame with bad CRC?

options.A: The switch floods the frame to all ports except the port through which the frame arrived to notify the hosts of the error.
options.B: The switch places the new CRC value in the FCS field and forwards the frame.
options.D: The switch notifies the source of the bad frame.

question: What does the IP address 192.168.1.15/29 represent?

options.A: multicast address
options.D: unicast address

question: What type of address is 198.133.219.162?

options.A: multicast
options.D: public

question: Given network 172.18.109.0, which subnet mask would be used if 6 host bits were available?
What are two ways to protect a computer from malware?

options.A: Empty the browser cache.
options.D: Keep software up to date.

question: Which two ICMP messages are used by both IPv4 and IPv6 protocols?

options.A: route redirection
options.D: neighbor solicitation

question: Which statement about the IPv6 loopback address is true?

options.A: It is a public address.
options.C: It is used for testing purposes within the host.
options.D: It can be assigned to multiple interfaces.
